description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

0.1.0.description:
Includes:
All chapters supported except Hell.
Several victory conditions, including completing x number of major side quests, escape spellhold, and defeat firkraag/kangaxx/irenicus.

Randomized Items:
Key items
Area unlocks
Companions (optional)
Equipment (optional)
Gold (filler)

Locations:
Quest progress
Defeating enemies
Container/room looting (optional)
Companion Quests (optional)

Options:
Choose how many chapters to include
Include/exclude Enhanced Edition content 
Include/exclude Chapter 1 / Irenicus Dungeon
Include/exclude City of Caverns / Sahaguin City in Chapter 4
Progressive equipment based on the +x bonuses
Collector’s edition items 
Support for Gibberlings 3 Item Randomizer mod

Game progression is locked by area unlocks and key items. You are expected to use the cheat console to give yourself received items. All relevant items have the item code in the name, so you won’t have to look them up. See the readme for how to use the cheat console.

Alternatively, there is an optional mod I made for the game. The GO_AP mod adds APITEM to Imoen’s inventory at the start of the game and to Ribald’s store in Waukeen’s Promenade. When you right-click -> Converse with this item in your inventory, it opens a menu where you can tell it which items you’ve received, and it’ll give them to you. It can also teleport you to unlocked areas for faster travel. The mod is meant to be easier than using the cheat console since you won’t have to type anything. See the setup guide for instructions on installing the mod.

Known issues:
If you choose to start with companions, you have to click the “Starting Companion” location checks to receive them. 
If you exclude Irenicus's Dungeon, you have to click the “Waukeen's Promenade Unlock” location check to immediately receive the Waukeen's Promenade Unlock. This will put Waukeen's Promenade into logic.
If you exclude Irenicus's Dungeon, Sphere 1 is pretty big. I’m open to suggestions on how to lock it down. 
Item categories for options you didn’t choose will still appear in the Manual Client. I tried my best to organize the items so the same type of items are grouped together.
Watcher's Keep checks are not implemented yet.
Some location names are too long so they are cut off in the Manual Client. This is a limitation of the Manual Client.
In the generated template yaml, the goal option shows up at the bottom of the option list.
When Equipment is included, only one ‘count’ of each equipment is put in the item pool, even if more copies exist in the vanilla game. I can adjust this upon request (thinking mostly about boots of speed) but for now it's just 1 for everything. 

GO_AP mod known issues:
The GO_AP conversation menu might not show a specific item if you already have it in your inventory. Simply drop the duplicate item and then it should show up in the menu.
The GO_AP mod currently does not include scrolls/potions. 
The GO_AP mod will always put the items into the 1st party slot’s inventory and will force something at random onto the ground if there’s no room.
Equipment received through the mod is always unidentified.
There is no option to receive the gold filler through the mod.

Since this is the initial release, I expect issues. I’m expecting typos especially with item codes for the cheat console and the GO_AP mod. Please report these issues!

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Angevon-1/manual_baldursgate2_angevon/commits/0.1.0

0.2.0.description:
Changes to apworld and yaml:
- Added a new option to handle miscellaneous items.
- Some logic fixes (turns out Rayic Gethras's house isn't available to loot until you're on Edwin's quest to kill him)
- Fixes for generation errors.
0.2.0.title: Baldur’s Gate 2: Shadows of Amn Archipelago Manual v0.2.0

0.3.0.description:
Changes to apworld and yaml:
Fixed generation failures when include_irenicus_dungeon was false. (i.e. fixed the start_inventory).
Added support for up to 29 different mod npcs to be included as randomized companions.

Changes to GO_AP mod:
Fixed scimitars which were showing up as short swords instead.
